verses.text: 神照各人所作的報應各人你這判斷人的啊！無論你是誰，都沒有辦法推諉。你在甚麼事上判斷人，就在甚麼事上定自己的罪；因為你所作的，正是你所判斷的事。

words.note: Forms a nominal phrase with a verb (所作的 = 'that which is done')
Nominalizes the preceding phrase '所作'
Often refers to divine judgment or karma.
Forms 'the one who judges'
Indicates sphere or aspect, similar to 'in which respect'.
Indicates sphere or aspect, similar to 'in which respect'.
Forms a nominal phrase with a verb (所作的 = 'that which is done')
Nominalizes the preceding phrase '所作'
Forms a nominal phrase with a verb (所判斷的 = 'that which is judged')
Nominalizes the preceding phrase '所判斷'

verses.text: 我們知道， 神必照著真理審判行這些事的人。

words.note: In a theological context, often refers to divine truth.
Refers to both the act of judging and the resulting judgment.
Forms 'those who do these things'.

verses.text: 你這個人，你判斷行這些事的人，自己所行的卻是一樣，你以為能逃脫 神的審判嗎？

words.note: 你這個人 is a common way to refer to 'you, this person'.
Forms 'those who do these things'.
Forms a nominal phrase with a verb (所行的 = 'that which is done')
Nominalizes the preceding phrase '所行'

verses.text: 還是你藐視 神豐富的恩慈、寬容和忍耐，不曉得他的恩慈是要領你悔改的嗎？

words.note: Refers to benevolent grace or loving-kindness.
Refers to benevolent grace or loving-kindness.
A key concept in Christian theology meaning to turn from sin.
Emphasizes the purpose or intention of the preceding action.

verses.text: 可是你一直硬著心腸，不肯悔改，為自己積蓄 神的忿怒，就是他彰顯公義審判的那天所要發的忿怒。

words.note: Indicates a continuous or sustained state/action.
Refers to one's innermost feelings or character.
A key concept in Christian theology meaning to turn from sin.
Often refers to divine anger or indignation.
In a theological context, refers to divine justice and moral uprightness.
Forms a nominal phrase with a verb (所要發的 = 'that which will be issued')
Nominalizes the preceding phrase '所要發'
Often refers to divine anger or indignation.

verses.text: 神必照各人所作的報應各人：

words.note: Forms a nominal phrase with following verb.
Often implies negative consequence; can be positive too.

verses.text: 以永生報答那些耐心行善、尋求榮耀尊貴和不朽的人，

words.note: Implies positive repayment or gratitude.

verses.text: 卻以震怒和憤恨報應那些自私自利、不順從真理而順從不義的人；

words.note: Often implies negative consequence; can be positive too.

verses.text: 把患難和愁苦加給所有作惡的人，先是猶太人，後是希臘人，

words.note: Introduces the object before the verb.
Lit. 'Judea people'.
Lit. 'Greece people'.

verses.text: 卻把榮耀、尊貴與平安賜給所有行善的人，先是猶太人，後是希臘人。

words.note: Introduces the object before the verb.
Lit. 'Judea people'.
Lit. 'Greece people'.

verses.text: 因為 神並不偏待人。

words.note: Refers to the Christian God; often capitalized in context.
Emphasizes the negation that follows.
Specifically implies unfair treatment due to bias.

verses.text: 律法的作用刻在人心凡不在律法之下犯了罪的，將不按律法而滅亡；凡在律法之下犯了罪的，將按律法受審判。

words.note: Verb-object compound: to commit sin.
Verb-object compound: to undergo judgment.

verses.text: 因為在 神面前，不是聽律法的為義，而是行律法的得稱為義。

words.note: Verb-object compound: to be considered righteous.
Indicates achieving a state or outcome.
A theological term meaning to be made right with God.

verses.text: 沒有律法的外族人，如果按本性行律法上的事，他們雖然沒有律法，自己就是自己的律法；

words.note: Term used in the Bible for non-Jewish people.
Used here to mean 'of the law' or 'related to the law'.

verses.text: 這就表明律法的作用是刻在他們的心裡，有他們的良心一同作證，他們的思想互相較量，或作控告、或作辯護。

words.note: Verb-object compound: to serve as evidence/witness.
Here implies an internal debate or argument.

verses.text: 這也要照著我所傳的福音，在 神藉著耶穌基督審判各人隱情的那一天，彰顯出來。

words.note: Connects verb to object/agent, forming a nominalized phrase.
Lit. 'blessed news'

verses.text: 內心作猶太人的才是猶太人你身為猶太人，倚靠律法，仗著 神誇口，
而且明白他的旨意，又從律法得了教導，能夠辨別甚麼是好的，
自信是瞎子的嚮導，在黑暗中的人的光，

words.note: Used as a postposition indicating 'in the midst of'.

verses.text: 愚昧人的導師，小孩子的教師，在律法上得了整套的知識和真理；

words.note: Used as a postposition with '在' to indicate aspect or scope.

verses.text: 你既然教導別人，難道不教導自己嗎？你傳講不可偷竊，自己卻偷竊嗎？

words.note: Used to pose a rhetorical question expecting a 'no' answer.

verses.text: 你說不可姦淫，自己卻姦淫嗎？你憎惡偶像，自己卻劫掠廟宇嗎？

words.note: Lit. 'image figure'.

verses.text: 你既然以律法誇口，自己卻因犯律法而羞辱 神嗎？

words.note: Often refers to the Mosaic Law.
Often preceded by a reverence space (　) in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 正如經上所說的：「 神的名，因你們的緣故在列邦中被褻瀆。」

words.note: 所 + V forms a nominalized verb phrase.
Often preceded by a reverence space (　) in Chinese Bibles.
Refers to Gentile nations in biblical context.

verses.text: 你若遵行律法，割禮固然有益處；但你若是犯律法的，你的割禮就不是割禮了。

words.note: Forms a noun phrase from the preceding verb phrase.
Indicates change of state or completion.

verses.text: 這樣，沒有受割禮的人，如果遵守律法所規定的，他雖然沒有受過割禮，不也算是受過割禮的嗎？

words.note: Refers to the Mosaic Law.
Indicates a passive or nominalized action.
Used in rhetorical questions.

verses.text: 那本來沒有受割禮卻遵守律法的人，就要審判你這有儀文和割禮而犯律法的人。

words.note: Refers to the Mosaic Law.
Also has strong biblical connotation.
Often refers to the external, ritualistic aspects of the Law.
Connects clauses, often showing consequence or contrast.
Refers to the Mosaic Law.

verses.text: 因為表面上作猶太人的並不是猶太人，在肉身上表面的割禮也不是割禮。

words.note: Often refers to the physical or sinful nature in biblical context.
Used as a postposition to indicate 'on the aspect of'.

verses.text: 唯有在內心作猶太人的才是猶太人；割禮也是心裡的，是靠著聖靈而不是靠著儀文。這樣的人所受的稱讚，不是從人來的，而是從 神來的。

words.note: Emphasizes exclusivity.
Indicates a condition must be met for something to happen.
Connects contrasting clauses.
Often refers to the external, ritualistic aspects of the Law.
Indicates a passive or nominalized action.
Connects clauses, often showing contrast or alternative.
Refers to the singular, specific God. The preceding space is a common honorific in Chinese Bibles.
